Method Detail

getPixels

public static int[] getPixels(java.awt.Rectangle boundingBox,
                              java.awt.Shape geometricShape)
getPixels creates a flattened pixel array (one-dimensional array of pixel data) representing the Shape object in black and the bounding box as transparent. This overloaded version of getPixel calls the getPixel(Dimension, Shape) method.
Parameters:
boundingBox:Ljava.awt.Rectangle - object representing the bounding box around the Shape object (constituting the Shape object's canvas). Note that the bounding box will be transparent.
geometricShape:Ljav.awt.Shape - object for which pixel data will be generated (represented by the black pixels).
Returns:
a integer array containing the pixel data.

getPixels

public static int[] getPixels(java.awt.Dimension canvasSize,
                              java.awt.Shape geometricShape)
getPixels creates a flattened pixel array (one-dimensional array of pixel data) representing the Shape object in black and the canvas as transparent.
Parameters:
canvasSize:Ljava.awt.Dimension - object representing the size of the canvas for which the geometric shape will be drawn (note that areas of the canvas not contained by the Shape obejct will be transparent).
geometricShape:Ljav.awt.Shape - object for which pixel data will be generated (represented by the black pixels).
Returns:
a integer array containing the pixel data.
